page.title: 13MOFFAT-A YOUTHFUL VIEW
page.content:
Mrs Boyd remarks that some buildings on the High Street have been changed, many shop fronts have been modernized and in her opinion completely ruined. Mrs Boyd thinks it would be nice if tourists remained in Moffat for longer periods instead of one or two nights.
Unlike older residents of Moffat teenagers are not so contented with life in the town.They complain of the lack of a swimming pool,cinema and other sources of teenage entertainment.They feel that Moffat is a place for old people to retire to and not a place for teenagers to live. Children who have not reached their teens are very happy to live here taking part in such activities as Majorettes,Brownies,Cubs,Guides,Scouts ,Youth Theatre and other clubs like the Young Ornithologists.
